schedule.heading: Provisions with respect to Board and Committees and their Members, etc.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Members of Board to disclose interests in respect of certain contracts

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Board who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a contract made or proposed to be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a committee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee or agent of the Board,

subsection.continued: shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Board.

subsection.content: The Board shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the Board.

subsection.leadIn: A member who has an interest in a contract referred to in subsection (1)—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: shall not without the permission of the Chairperson or other member presiding take any part in any deliberation of the Board with respect to that contract; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: shall not in any event vote on any matter concerning it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a member may give a notice in writing at a meeting of the Board to the effect that he is a member of a company or firm and is to be regarded as interested in any contract which may, after the date of the notice, be made with the company or firm and the notice shall be regarded as a sufficient disclosure of his interest in relation to any contract so made or proposed to be so made.

A member of the Board need not attend in person at a meeting of the Board to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Voting
section.content: All matters for determination at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting and where there is an equality of votes the Chairperson or other member presiding shall have a casting vote in addition to his original vote.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fixing of seal of Board
section.leadIn: The fixing of the seal of the Board shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorized by the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: authenticated by the signatures of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chairperson; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other member of the Board authorized by the Board, either generally or specifically, to act for that purpose.

subsection.content: The Board may make and execute any document in the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers or in connection with any matter reasonably incidental to or consequential upon the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers.
Any document purporting to be executed under the seal of the Board shall be admitted in evidence and shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to have been duly executed.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Certain documents not required to be sealed
section.content: Any contract or instrument which, if entered into or executed by a person not being a body corporate, would not be required to be under seal may be entered into or executed on behalf of the Board by any member of the Board generally or specifically authorized by the Board for that purpose.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Procedure of Board
section.content: Subject to the provisions of this Schedule, the Board shall have power to regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Board may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Board.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appoint members of the Board, and persons who are not such members, to be members of a committee other than a disciplinary committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall appoint the chairperson of a committee and determine the number of members of a committee.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Members of committee to disclose interests in respect of certain contracts

subsection.leadIn: A member of a committee who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a contract made or proposed to be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the committee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee or agent of the Board,

subsection.continued: shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the committee.

subsection.content: The committee shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the committee.

subsection.leadIn: A member who has an interest in a contract referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not without the permission of the chairperson of the committee or other member presiding take any part in any deliberation of the committee with respect to that contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not in any event vote on any matter concerning it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a member may give a notice in writing at a meeting of a committee to the effect that he is a member of a company or firm and is to be regarded as interested in any contract which may, after the date of the notice, be made with the company or firm and the notice shall be regarded as a sufficient disclosure of his interest in relation to any contract so made or proposed to be so made.

A member of a committee need not attend in person at a meeting of the committee to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.

subsection.leadIn: The resources of the Board consist of— (Amended 18 of 2024 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all money and property, including gifts, donations, fees, rent, interest and accumulations of income received by the Board. (Amended 18 of 2024 s. 26)

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Savings and Transitional Provisions relating to Social Workers Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Amending Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Social Workers Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (18 of 2024);
material date (關鍵日期) means the date on which this Schedule comes into operation*;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the material date.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Chairperson and Deputy Chairperson of Board and transaction of business of Board

subsection.leadIn: At the beginning of the material date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who held the office of the Chairperson of the Board immediately before the material date ceases to hold that office;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the offices of the Chairperson and Deputy Chairperson of the Board become vacant.

subsection.leadIn: Beginning on the material date, despite any other provisions of this Ordinance, the Board may not transact any business until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Board is appointed by the Chief Executive to be the Chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Board is appointed by the Chief Executive to be the Deputy Chairperson.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (2) is taken to be appointed under section 4(5).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Pre-existing complaint concerning disciplinary offence pending decision of referral

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if, before the material date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a form in which a complaint concerning a disciplinary offence is made has been submitted to 2 members of the Board (pre-existing members) under section 25(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pre-existing members have not decided whether to refer the complaint to the Board under that section.

subsection.leadIn: On or after the material date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar must, as soon as practicable, in accordance with the rules made by the Board under section 9, submit the form referred to in subsection (1)(a) to 1 additional member of the Board (additional member) appointed by the Board for the purposes of section 25(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the additional member and the pre-existing members together must act under section 25(3).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Pre-existing complaint concerning disciplinary offence referred under section 25(3) of pre-amended Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, before the material date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a registered social worker—

subparagraph.leadIn: has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: may bring the profession of social worker into disrepute; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is punishable with imprisonment (whether or not the social worker was sentenced to imprisonment); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a complaint concerning a disciplinary offence under section 25(1)(e) or (f) of the pre-amended Ordinance has been made in relation to the conviction of an offence mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) or (ii) (pre-existing complaint), irrespective of whether the pre-existing complaint also concerns any disciplinary offence under section 25(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the pre-existing complaint has been referred to the Board under section 25(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the material date, the Board has not appointed a disciplinary committee in accordance with section 27(1) in relation to the pre-existing complaint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the pre-existing complaint only concerns a disciplinary offence under section 25(1)(e) or (f) of the pre-amended Ordinance, on or after the material date—

subparagraph.content: the pre-existing complaint is not to be further dealt with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: otherwise, on or after the material date—

subparagraph.content: the disciplinary committee appointed under subparagraph (i) may only inquire into the pre-existing complaint in so far as it concerns a disciplinary offence under section 25(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, subsection (2) does not affect the application of Part IIIA in relation to the conviction of an offence mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii) in relation to which the pre-existing complaint has been made.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the material date, the Board has appointed a disciplinary committee in accordance with section 27(1) in relation to the pre-existing complaint, on or after the material date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part IV of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to apply in relation to the pre-existing complaint and the proceedings arising from that complaint as if the Amending Ordinance had not been enacted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Part IIIA does not apply in relation to the conviction of an offence mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii) in relation to which the pre-existing complaint has been made.
